      Maze(int x, int y)

      Boolean that makes sure a specified index is valid for the Maze array

      Resets HashSet for use in ShortestPath method
      private void setPoints()
      Sets random points for both the player's start and the exit of the maze; bounds to make sure player and goal aren't too close isnt precise, but at least it stops direct spawns side-by-side
      java.util.Stack<java.awt.Point> shortestPath()
      Breath-first traversal that finds the goal relative to the player start, and keeps track of where each index was visited from via use of a HashMap.

    • Method Detail

      • createMaze

        private void createMaze(int cWidth,
                        int cHeight)
        Recursive function that generates a random maze using a recursive backtracking algorithm
        Parameters:
        cWidth - - current Width index
        cHeight - - current Height index

      • arrayBounds

        private boolean arrayBounds(int index,
                            int max)
        Boolean that makes sure a specified index is valid for the Maze array
        Parameters:
        index - - index being checked
        max - - bounds that index must be smaller than
        Returns:
        - returns whether index is valid or not

      • setPoints

        private void setPoints()
        Sets random points for both the player's start and the exit of the maze; bounds to make sure player and goal aren't too close isnt precise, but at least it stops direct spawns side-by-side

      • shortestPath

        public java.util.Stack<java.awt.Point> shortestPath()
        Breath-first traversal that finds the goal relative to the player start, and keeps track of where each index was visited from via use of a HashMap. After finding the goal, each Point from the goal backward to the playerStart is pushed into a Stack, which is then returned for use by the PathfindingBot
        Returns:
        - returns a Stack with all the Points leading from start to goal, with starting point on top

      • resetVisited

        public void resetVisited()
        Resets HashSet for use in ShortestPath method

      • getGoal

        public java.awt.Point getGoal()
        Returns:
        - returns Goal of map

      • getStart

        public java.awt.Point getStart()
        Returns:
        - returns starting point of map

      • getMap

        public int[][] getMap()
        Returns:
        - returns int array which contains the map
